Author: jl777c#5810
Content: mm2 is in testing now, we are moving away from mm1

Author: coingirl87#6489
Content: That sounds good...any idea when mm2 will be ready? Not an exatly date but maybe month/ quarter?

Author: coingirl87#6489
Content: And what is different to mm1? Is there a comparison chart or graphic? That would be fine

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is in testing now, so far it is doing well. it is restructured and able to run on mobile, improved networking and uses a more basic atomic swap now that all the coins support CLTV

Author: coingirl87#6489
Content: Ok nice to hear.  I am excited about performance of mm2. In my opinion the biggest problem was the one with liquidity. Are there any plans how to solve that?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with mm2, there is not much difference between alice and bob, so all nodes should automatically provide liquidity. basically all the trouble spots of mm1 are fixed with mm2

Content: Ok thank you for your answerğŸ‘

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
technically, there's never been an "official" "team" for "BarterDEX GUI"
That being said, yes I have been involved in it in the past and plan on resuming where I left off in the near future
As for "user friendly", no matter what the project, devs can't make "user friendly" changes if users refuse to give feedback about what is/isn't "friendly" (if you see something that needs changed, say something)

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content: \*"you" being general, not *you* specifically

Author: ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢#7004
Content:
much of the non-"user friendly" bits of BarterDEX GUI are a direct result of
>this thing sux
>What exactly is wrong? What can we fix?
>It just sux
Nothing ever gets changed with feedback like that
